Commodity code.description: The "Commodity code" column represents unique numerical identifiers assigned to different types of products or goods for classification and tracking purposes in inventory or trade systems.

Controlled atmosphere container.description: This column indicates whether a shipping container has a controlled atmosphere system installed to regulate environmental conditions during transport.

Eppocode.description: Employee position or project codes representing unique identifiers for job classifications or assignments within the organization.

Genus and Species.description: The actual scientific name of the product or plants for planting. For example, "Rosa hybrid" for hybrid roses.

Intended for final users (or commercial.description: This column indicates whether the plant product is ready for end consumers or commercial flower growers, with "Finished" signifying products that are market-ready.

Net weight (kg).description: The net weight of products in kilograms, excluding packaging or containers. Also known as Peso Unitario.

Number of packages.description: The quantity of packages of each product.

Quantity.description: The numerical count or amount of products included in each transaction or order.

Quantity type.description: This column indicates the unit of measure for inventory or sales items, such as 'PCS' for pieces, 'BLB' for bulbs, 'CRZ' for corns and rhizomes, 'KGM' for kilograms, 'PTC' for plants in tissue culture, 'SDS' for seeds, or 'STM' for stems.

Type of package.description: This column indicates the category or format of packaging used for a product or service.

required: Intended for final users (or commercial flower production)
